page.title: 02THE EXPRESS AND ECHO
page.content: The Express and Echo is one of several daily local newspapers owned by the Western Morning Times. It is circulated throughout Devon and Somerset. On average, 37 479 copies are sold daily. Over 300 people are employed by the Express and Echo in Exeter. The paper is planned one day in advance. An editorial committee meets in the morning to organise the layout and content of the next day's issue. It is printed between 8am and noon and is ready for distribution by 1pm. The paper can be 50 pages long. Advertisements take up 60% of the space, news, 40%. The advertisememts help finance the paper. Popular stories concern people, the maltreatment of animals and politicans.The sports pages are very popular.
